result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A. Silber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Probation may be served in the county in which the defendant resides.

miscConds.notes:
DNA sample unless already provided.
Complete AODA.
Complete any treatment as recommended.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Participate in counseling as deemed necessary by agent. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full time employment 30 hours/week or apply for at least 5 jobs/week qualified for or satisfy agent in that process of applying for social security disability.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael A. Silber

defendant.name: Silber, Michael A.
defendant.address: 7668 Four Mile Creek Road, Three Lakes, WI 54562

records.addlTxt: Clerk's Letter RE: Return of Bond

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: 10:33 AM Room 301 Defendant Michael A. Silber in court.  Attorney John Zich in court for Michael A. Silber.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Plea agreement. State requests def plea on Ct. 1 - withheld sentence 3 yrs Probation, Court Costs, DNA sample unless already provided, Surcharge, AODA, Complete any treatment recommended, Maintain Absolute Sobriety, Maintain Fulltime Employment, Participate in Counseling deemed necessary by agent, does not object to early discharge in probation after 2 years, or if agent decides to allow def to discharge earlier from probation. On Ct. 2 - jail sentence of time served, Court Costs, DNA sample unless already provided, Surcharge. Defense notes def is in process of applying for disability so may need to revisit fulltime employment aspect. Court reviews plea questionnaire. Defendant pleas guilty to ct. 1 & ct. 2. Court advises of constitutional rights. Court advises of elements and penalties. Court warns of possible deportation. Def atty. is satisfied. Def enters in plea agreement freely. Court finds def enters freely in plea agreement. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas, and finds def guilty of ct. 1 & ct. 2. Sentencing remarks by state. Sentencing remarks by defense. Remarks by defendant. Court gives remarks. Court will abide by plea agreement. Court orders on Ct. 1 - withheld sentence 3 yrs Probation, Court Costs only, DNA sample unless already provided, $250 Surcharge, complete AODA, Complete any treatment recommended, Maintain Absolute Sobriety, Either be fulltime employed or actively seeking, or satisfy agent that in process of applying for SS disability, Participate in Counseling deemed necessary by agent. Ct. 2 - jail sentence of time served, Court Costs, DNA sample unless already provided, $200 Surcharge. Firearms and voting restrictions given. Credit - 2 days. On Ct. 2 - 2 days jail. credit for 2 days served. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. $1800 cash bond will be used to retire to court costs on both counts, rest of balance refunded to person who posted. Post conviction rights given. Court notes def will be on probation in county they reside.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.

1:39 PM /Room 203/ Defendant Michael A. Silber in court.  Attorney John Zich appeared by video for Michael A. Silber.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Off the record - Def waives right. State has cancelled witness. Court reviews waiver of preliminary hearing with defendant. Court advises defendant of rights. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Defendant has voluntarily waived hearing. Court finds probable cause and binds case over. State has filed copy of information to def atty. State is comfortable with arraignment today. Defendants atty has received copies, waives reading, reserves objections, and enter pleas of not guilty on all charges. Court has received pleas of not guilty. October 17th @ 11:00 AM for Stc.
Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.

1:39 PM Defendant Michael A. Silber in court.  Attorney John Zich in court for Michael A. Silber via zoom.  Attorney Kelly Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Zich has received a copy of the criminal complaint and waives reading, requests timely preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
2:16 PM Defendant Michael A. Silber in court.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court reviews history of case.  Def. contacted P.D. and does qualify.  Bond continues.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Maintain absolute sobriety. No illegal use or possession of controlled substances.

1:16 PM/Room 203. Defendant Michael A. Silber appeared by video, in custody in Langlade County Jail .  Attorney Kelly Hays  in court for State of Wisconsin. All appearances are by Zoom. Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. State heard on bond, recommends $2,000 cash bond with conditions maintain absolute sobriety, no illegal use or possession of controlled substances. Def. heard on bond. The Court orders $1,800 cash bond with conditions as requested.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
